posts.cooked: We have a 3dwox1 3d printer and for about a week we had this issue where the bowden tube keeps popping out (from the filment side) we tried putting tape to hold it and cleaned the noozle and tube but it didn’t help. When we tried to switch the tube for a diffrent one we had from our makerbot we kept getting an eror that the filment can’t transfer correctly (the printer work for about 5-10 min and then stops) Is there any other solution we can try to solve it?

posts.name: Electra Lucky Norwood
posts.cooked:
Can you send a picture of what your bowden tube looks like?

For some printers, there is a blue “capture” piece you slot in to keep the bowden tube from being pulled out. And sometimes the fitting itself is too worn to hold it in place properly, so it may need replaced.

posts.name: Zyrano
posts.cooked: Are you popping off that white piece before inserting the new tube?

posts.name: Electra Lucky Norwood
posts.cooked:
I would try replacing the fitting and ensuring that the bowden tube is inserted correctly on the nozzle-side as well. If you have a gap there, it will cause printing and heating issues. Would probably be worth looking up how to properly change the bowden tube on the type of printer you have to ensure you are doing it properly. I made that mistake on my bowden tube on my Ender 3 V2 at home and I was taught to heat up the nozzle, unscrew it a couple turns, then put in the bowden tube and tighten it back up to ensure there is no gap.

That being said, I have little experience with the type of printer you have, so I do not know if this applies to it or not.

posts.name: Hunter Smith
posts.cooked: Hey! If I were you, I would go through and replace that coupling…it seems like it just isnt biting anymore… hope it helps:)

posts.name: NathanNFM
posts.cooked: I agree, that you likely need to replace the fitting, but first, you could try cutting ~1/2" off the end of the tube before re-inserting it, once it pulls out once it can get scraped up making it easier to be pulled out in the future.
